soft and malleable metal that is silvery with a hint of blue and tarnishes to a dull gray

a silvery-white metal
bluish-white, lustrous, diamagnetic metal

magical form of bronze mined from Mount Celestia

Metal from the lowest levels of the nine hells - used to make archdevil weapons and armor
a white-silver metal that is rumored to be delivered to the chosen founder by Selûne herself
silvery white metal, tarnishing to dark gray in air
pale silvery green, a stygian iron-cerebium alloy
A silvery grey-white metal made from the remnents of Titans of old
highly durable and capable of holding enchantments
solid white-blue metal that is extremely durable and light, as well as being completely vibration absorbent - when hit by concussive sound, is turned into heat and light
extremely durable green pearlescent alloy made from adamant, silver, and gold
a black crystalline metal that repels heat and light
silver hue when it was cut and polished, while its exposed surfaces shone with a purple gleam. Extremely durable and light.
gray with a purple hue alloy of iron and Warpstone
a yellow precious metal
Dark red metal found in the nine hells
Green glowing metal, regenerates damage by "flowing" back together
glowing red-orange molten metal, never seems to fully cool
a ore appeared as black and white, and refined into a black and white damascus finish. The metal that has a two natural resonances that are in a polyrhythmic interval
emerald colored stone, maliable, has a neon green glow.
Black with pearlescent quality, extremely hard but brittle metal refined from adamantite ore
Purplish white metal
a gray metal that absorbs light around it
glowing yellow-orange metal
light, soft, silvery-white metal and highly flammable
Mithral ore appeared as a silver-and-black mineral in its natural form, and became a shining silvery-blue when it forged, extremely light
red copper-gold
a precious shiny grayish-white metal
hard steel-grey metal that is often brittle
a pink metal that has an affinity to life-essence
metal alloy with a wide natural resonance range, amplifying sound waves
a black and purple metal that pulses with a faintly glowing blue light
Psionic superhard Cerebium-Iron alloy
a metal of swirling green, purple, yellow and red colors. The metal is unpredictable and requires extreme care in the refining and forging process or catastrophic results may occur
platinum, gold, and orichalcum alloy. Extremely harmful to magical creatures, but cannot harm non-magical creatures.
a precious silvery-white metal
rare substance that "gives off a wavelength that is the same as the sea itself"
a dark yellow alloy made from infernal iron and stygian iron, that has unique properties regarding souls
a pale green metal that grows off the coast of the river styx.
a metal with black oxidated coating and silvery gray metallic inside
glossy green, kidney shaped leaves and solitary dull purple flowers
a cone with unusually fleshy and merged scales
yellow, orange, or copper-brown flowers
woody stem with pale pink flowers and very fragrant
leathery leaves with white glutinous berries
Leaves from the Olisuba bush, has a bright yellow-green color.
A shelf-like fungus that resembles a mass of rotting flesh. It is surprisingly edible. Though it can be eaten raw, it tastes better roasted. A single sheet of ripplebark yields 1d4+6 pounds of food
prickly bush or shrub that typically bears red, pink, yellow, or white fragrant flowers
Stems are stiff and woody and leaves are small, oval and gray-green in color.  Flowers can be white to lilac and are in small clusters

phosphorescent flower that resemble a firepit that produce flame, lighting the area as well as a torch. If picked, light lasts for 2 hours before dimming to half its brightness and lasts for another 2 hours before completely gone.
It has thin, blunt tipped leaves, which are usually light red. It also grows quite large flowers, which can be dark red, grey, brown and light brown.
It has small, lobed leaves, which are usually dark yellow. It also grows quite small flowers, which can be yellow and dark grey.
dark green leaves with white or light pink flowers with boat-shaped petals
It has huge, egg shaped leaves, which are usually dark orange. It also grows small flowers, which can be light purple, orange, dark orange and white.
It has thin, squared leaves, which are usually mint green. It also grows small flowers, which can be light gold, white and red.

large plant and can be found only in very damp places. It blooms in late autumn.
It has huge, wedge shaped leaves, which are usually dark green. It also grows huge flowers, which can be bronze and dark pink.

These plants grow alone, but within a decent distance from each other, but its very easy to control and maintain their growth.
tall plant, It has thin, spear shaped leaves, which are usually light orange. It also grows a single flower at the apex, which can be light blue, light pink and white.
It has huge, heart shaped leaves, which are usually dark orange. It also grows quite large flowers, which can be white and blue.
tiny flower looks like a bright blue dandelion seed head. Even though it looks pretty, the stem is the only usable part for alchemical concoctions
dubbed the "grain of the Underdark", a bluecap is inedible, but spores can be ground to make a nutritious, bland, flour
pale orange-white, fire lichen thrive on warmth, so it grows in regions of geothermal heat. Can be ground and fermented into a hot, spicy paste. Duergar also ferrment fire lichen into a spicy liquor
ovate to oblong leaves toward the lower part of the stem, which is capped by a tall, one-sided cluster of pendulous, bell-shaped flowers
Large, brightly colored flowers(red, pink, yellow, white)
blueish-green plant that emits a constant hum
yellow and blue flower that gives off a faint cold glow
small plant with long purple leaves, blocks out your super-ego and makes you give into base desires.
red vine type plant, with purple flowers when in bloom. The plants skin has metallic attributes. The red color is actually rust, made by the oxidization of the metallic cuticle of the plant

An edible fungus of brownish-red color with four pedals resembling tongues with small hairs covering the surface. A creature that eats the tongue of madness must succeed on a DC 12 Con save or compulsively speak aloud its every thought for the next hour. (can be ended with lesser restoration or similar magic)

a massive mushroom that can reach a height of thirty to forty feet. Its large grain-like spores are edible and ntritionally equivalent to 1d4+4 lbs. of food, butmore important for its hard and woody stalks. One of the few sources of timber in the Underdark, used to make furniture, containers, bridges, and rafts, among other things.
dark pink flower with a thorny stem
tiny white yellow flower
large, caskshaped fungus that can be tapped and drained of fresh water stored within. 1d4+4 gallons of water and 1d6+4 lbs. of food
Purple stem with yellow petals
red-brown mossy herb that, when heated (even from the friction of rubbing it between your fingers), releases wisps of smoke that create feelings of euphoria
green stem, red leaves in the shape of hearts, flowers only bloom for one night and then wilt. (sought by lovers)
white and blue flower

yellow flowers have been reported as having an unpleasant odor variously described as similar to mothballs or animal urine or sweet but with "a pronounced fecal element" fruits consist of segments of bright orange flesh, each surrounding a black seed. While the flesh looks attractive enough to eat, it is best not to. A minute or so after eating, the flesh produces an unpleasant burning sensation in the mouth and lips

a mushroom that grows to a height of four to five feet, and has broad gray-green cap and a light gray stalk. The caps leathery surface can be cut and cleaned for use in making maps, hats, and scrolls (its surface takes on dyes and inks well). The stalk can be cleaned, soaked in water for an hour, then dried to make a platable food akin to bread. provides 1d6+4 lbs of food.
a bulbous fungus that grows in shallow water. A mature waterorb can be squeezed like a sponge, yielding a gallon of drinkable water and a pound of edible (chewy and tasteless) food.
blood red rose have a black stem with small reddish thorns

1-2ft tall mushroom with a combustible cap, once touched - a single dragonhart burns for 24 hours. There is a 1 in 6 chance that a dragonhart explodes instead, bursting into a cloud of fiery spores. creatures within 10ft take 1d6 fire damage.
Similar to a lillypad, this plant grows ont he surface of the water
It has thin, diamond shaped leaves, which are usually forest green. It also grows small flowers, which can be dark orange, light brown, light redblack.
This root have small air bags inside of it, and when the root is squished the air sounds like screams for a few seconds

A mushroom that grants any creature that eats it advantage on wisdom (perception) checks based on smell for 1d4 hours. However, the creature suffers disadvantage on saving throws against effects based on smell for the same amount of time.
bright orange and red leaves resembling a feather on fire
It has tiny, oval leaves, which are usually dark orange. It also grows tiny flowers, which can be dark brown, red, dark purple and dark orange.

AKA "the devils mushroom," a timmask is 2 tall toadstool with orange and red stripes across its beige cap. Uprooting or destroying a timmask causes it to expel a 15 radius cloud of poisonous spores. Creatures in the area must succeed at a DC 14 Con save or be poisoned for 1 minute. While poisoned in this way, creature is under the effect of the confusion spell.

It blooms twice a year, for 1 month.
It has thick, barb shaped leaves, which are usually purple. It also grows tiny flowers, which can be light orange, blue and light purple.

silvery wood, gives off a soft glow
a gargantuan living ash tree with branches extending above the heavens and a trunk strongly latched into the ground by three great roots
Wood from trees infused with lightning, gives off an audible crackling and static field
hard as normal wood but very light
dense and hard wood with dark, deeply furrowed bark
